identificationModule.briefTitle: Prehospital Transcranial Duplex in Patients With Acute Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Prehospital Transcranial Duplex in Patients With Acute Stroke

statusModule.whyStopped: Changes in preclinical treatment of stroke patients, no more emergency physician will met this patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of the study is to investigate patients with acute stroke prehospital with transcranial duplex ultrasound to detect an infarct of the middle cerebral artery.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The investigation of the patients will be done by an anaesthesiologist who is part of the prehospital medical treatment in Germany. The main question is, wether a non neurologist can detect an infarction of the middle cerebral artery in a short time an lead the patient to the indicated clinic.

armGroups.label: Patients with clinical signs of stroke
armGroups.description: Patients with clinical signs of stroke
interventionNames: Other: No intervention in this study

interventions.name: No intervention in this study
armGroupLabels: Patients with clinical signs of stroke

primaryOutcomes.measure: Prehospital detection of an infarction of the middle cerebral artery in patients with acute stroke

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* clinical signs of acute stroke
* possibility of TCD

Exclusion Criteria:

* acute interventions for vital signs required
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients with clinical signs of acute stroke in the teritorial of the middle cerebral artery

locations.facility: University Medical Center of the Johannes Gutenberg-University Mainz
